entry.content:
I need to take several notes every day with a consistent style and in an organized manner and with a tool available and synchronized across multiple devices. I need to take notes about a future blog article, a meeting, for a to do list ..., with a tool giving consistency and easy to use. After some research and after trying various solutions as Google Keep, Standard notes and Evernote, I discovered Notion. 

Notion is easy to use, very flexible and contains a lot of documents templates (and you can use community templates too). A lot of features are available, from exporting to PDF to share your doc with a team (paid feature). I recommend you to try it! 

 

Enjoy

entry.content:
I use a macbook almost every day, and I have a lot of apps opened all the time : iTerm2, Firefox, Spotify, Spark, Slack, VSCode and more... I like to have them displayed on differents "desktops" to switch between apps fast with my mouse. Until today, desktops moved sometimes from one position to another. Desktop 2 switched with Desktop 4 or another according a kind of random pattern I didn't identify. 

Finally, I decided to search a little on the internet and I found the guilty : Mission Control.

To enable/disable desktops reordering, go to 

System Prefs > Mission Control

And check/uncheck 

Automatically rearrange Spaces based on most recent use.

Thanks to Tetsujin 

Enjoy!

entry.title: TID Product Hunt Time Machine
entry.summary: To discover new things, a lot of web resources exist. You can use google to have informations on new trends, follow your favourite tech news blog or subscribe to RSS feed via Feedly for example. Few months ago, I discovered Product Hunt, where people and…
entry.content:
To discover new things, a lot of web resources exist. You can use google to have informations on new trends, follow your favourite tech news blog or subscribe to RSS feed via Feedly for example. Few months ago, I discovered Product Hunt, where people and companies can submit their new product and the community vote everyday for the best new one. 

A lot of products are interesting but sometimes, only the most voted one is really interesting (we can't disrupt everything everyday, right?) That's why exists Product Hunt Time Machine, compiling all the "most voted hunt from every day since Product Hunt records began".  

With this list, there is no reason to discover new things easily! 

 

Enjoy!

entry.title: TIL Git push --atomic
entry.summary: For continuous integration puropses, I need to be sure some of my commits are all done together. If some fail for some reasons, I have to reconciliate everything t o be sure it is ok. After some research, I found a git command that helped…
entry.content:
For continuous integration puropses, I need to be sure some of my commits are all done together. If some fail for some reasons, I have to reconciliate everything t o be sure it is ok. After some research, I found a git command that helped me a lot: 

git push --atomic origin branch1 branch2 ...

 The idea with this command is to have only one commit doing multiple things. It can help to merge, tag and add a note in a single command for example. 

For more informations, you can read this github article. 

 

Enjoy!
